abstract.p: Mattie Boone, 81-year-old woman in wheelchair, is killed while trying to protect her grown grandson from another man in her Bedford Stuyvesant apartment; grandson, Derrick Hairston, is slashed by attacker, who then fled (S)

block.p: An 81-year-old woman in a wheelchair was killed last night while trying to protect her grown grandson from another man in her Brooklyn apartment, the police said.
An 81-year-old woman in a wheelchair was killed last night while trying to protect her grown grandson from another man in her Brooklyn apartment, the police said.

The grandson, Derrick Hairston, 33, and an acquaintance were at first fighting outside the apartment, at 280 Stone Avenue in Bedford Stuyvesant, where Mr. Hairston lived with his grandmother, Mattie Boone, Lt. Dennis Cirillo said. After the fight moved inside, the other man cut Mr. Hairston with a sharp object, and when Ms. Boone tried to intervene, her ankles were badly slashed. The attacker then fled. Ms. Boone was dead on arrival at Brookdale Hospital, Lieutenant Cirillo said. Mr. Hairston was treated and released.
